This morning, three Russian Geran-2 drones struck a target in the Kholodnohirs'kyi District of Kharkiv City.
This morning, three Russian Geran-2 drones struck a target in the Kholodnohirs'kyi District of Kharkiv City.

Over the last week, local Palestinian armed groups affiliated with the Palestinian Islamic Jihad's Saraya Al-Quds Brigades claimed responsibility for two attacks in the West Bank.
On November 4, the "Tulkarm Brigade" stated that their fighters fired on a newly established Israeli outpost with small arms near the border with Israel west of the city of Tulkarm. This is the first recorded presence of Palestinian militants in the area of Tulkarm City in some time. IDF troops effectively occupy the city, which previously served as a stronghold for multiple armed groups.
On November 11, the "Nablus Brigade" stated that their fighters fired on an Israeli military vehicle with small arms near the "Alon Moreh" settlement east of Nablus. An increase in insurgent activity has been recorded in the Nablus area over the past month, which has seen very little activity recently due to frequent and sustained IDF raids.
No Israeli casualties were reported in either of these incidents.
Additionally, the Saraya Al-Quds Brigades announced the death of a fighter from the local armed group "Tubas Battalion" after he was killed by IDF troops in the Al-Fara'a Refugee Camp.

This morning, three Russian Geran-2 drones struck a target in the Kholodnohirs'kyi District of Kharkiv City.
Consequences of the morning Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on a warehouse facility in Kharkiv City.

I‚Äôm seeing a lot of ‚ÄúPro-Ukraine‚Äù accounts calling for mass mobilisation of more Ukrainian men today. 
To those people advocating for this, think for a second - would you go and volunteer yourself? Would you go and fight alongside the country you claim to support so much? 
Or are you happy with just sitting at home in your comfortable, peaceful country advocating for the killing of hundreds of thousands. Because that‚Äôs what it would mean - mass mobilisation of additional Ukrainians would be condemning a significant portion of them to their deaths. They will die for a war that cannot be won. 
All the while you have the audacity to claim that this is a good idea, while not being prepared to do anything yourself other than lie on Twitter for money and engagement. 
People like this are some of the most fucking vile, disgusting humans on this planet, and I truly hope that their statements will come back to haunt them once this war is over. 
You do not support Ukraine. You are only anti-Russia. You have blood on your hands.

Im happy to announce i will be doing an interview with AMK Mapping soon. Hopefully early next week at the latest, itll be uploaded to my youtube channel. We will be discussing what couldve happened if the invasion took place in 2014, as well as the origins of this conflict to begin with, before going into the future and what it holds. 
https://www.youtube.com/@hudsonwarmap

Russian forces have captured the village of Yablukove, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~48.
Total land area: ~0.11 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Rivnopillya, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~268.
Total land area: ~0.92 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Sukhyi Yar, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~237.
Total land area: ~0.49 km¬≤.
For those wondering, Pokrovsk has already effectively fallen. Only a couple of streets remain, meaning that any future progress within the city will be mostly symbolic.

Last night, Ukrainian Flamingo cruise missiles attacked the Oryol Thermal Power plant in Oryol Oblast. 
The number of missiles used is unknown, but it is known that 1 missile impacted and 1 was intercepted.

Last night, Ukrainian Flamingo cruise missiles attacked the Oryol Thermal Power plant in Oryol Oblast. 
The number of missiles used is unknown, but it is known that 1 missile impacted and 1 was intercepted.

Russian forces have captured the village of Danylivka, Hulyaipole direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~355.
Total land area: ~0.97 km¬≤.
Russian forces have captured the village of Danylivka, Hulyaipole direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.  Pre-war population: ~355. Total land area: ~0.97 km¬≤.

As a result of this advance, Russian forces have now physically cut the Hulyaipole - Pokrovsk'e Highway. 
Currently, there is only one usable paved road left leading into Hulyaipole, which is less than 6 km from the frontline, meaning it is under constant Russian drone surveillance.
The day AI becomes completely unbiased will be scary for many.

Update from the Pokrovsk direction:
As battles continue for the last streets of Pokrovsk, the defence of the besieged city of Myrnohrad has begun to falter. Russian forces are also advancing elsewhere, while the Ukrainians continue their push through Rodynske.
West of Pokrovsk, Russian forces continued their relatively quick advance through the fields between the two railway lines. They were able to make additional progress north of Kotlyne, capturing new treeline positions on the tactical heights, and advancing further north towards the second railway line. They also completed the capture of the dachas on the southeastern outskirts of Hryshyne and established control over new treeline positions on approach to the village. 
In Pokrovsk City, Russian forces continue attempts at consolidating in the northwestern-most street of the city, as well as the adjacent dachas. Ukrainian drone operators are attempting to prevent them from establishing this bridgehead over the Hrishynka River. Meanwhile, fighting continues on the eastern edge of Pokrovsk.
South of Myrnohrad, Russian forces consolidated in the second large trench fortification north of Lysivka and entered northern Sukhyi Yar. In coordination with attacks carried out from the south and east, the Russians were able to complete the capture of the village. 
In southern Myrnohrad, as a result of recent assault operations, Russian forces managed to entrench in the first high-rise buildings of the Zapadny District. They also improved their positions further in the low-rise residential streets to the south. 
In northern Myrnohrad, Russian forces broke through towards the centre of the city along the T-504 Highway, capturing new parts of the low-rise residential areas. They also advanced further in the northern high-rise buildings, establishing control over most of the remaining buildings north of Mukhamadyeyeva Street.
In Rodynske, Ukrainian forces were able to achieve some progress in the southwestern part of the city, capturing new positions in 3 blocks of 4-story buildings, as well as the treeline to the west. They are now attempting to break through the city centre to the southeastern high-rise microdistrict. A large grey zone has formed there.

Russian Army Captures Town Near Vovchansk, Expands Control In Kupyansk 
On November 13, the Russian military captured a settlement to the west of Vovchansk and expanded its control in the western part of the city of Kupyansk in Kharkiv.
The Russian Ministry of Defense said that Synelnykove was captured by the Sever [North] Group of Forces. The settlement was the focal point of intense battles with Kiev forces that went on for weeks. From there, Russian troops could advance to Liman, Tsehelne, and Prilypka.
More importantly, the capture of Synelnykove secures the recent gains by the Sever Group of Forces in the southwestern part of Vovchansk.
üëâ

Sukhoi Su-30 Multirole Fighter; The Versatile Backbone of Russian and Allied Air Forces
‚ñ™Ô∏è
The 
Sukhoi Su-30
 is a twin-engine multirole fighter and one of Russia‚Äôs most successful fourth-generation aircraft. With its high maneuverability, extended operational range, and capability to perform a wide array of aerial missions, it has become the backbone of the air forces of several nations. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
Derived from the design of the Su-27, the Su-30 has been developed in multiple variants and serves as a complementary platform to more advanced fighters like the Su-35. Its ability to conduct air-to-air and air-to-surface operations, reconnaissance, and aerial support has made it a popular choice in the global defense market.
Video: Su-30 fighter jet performs the Cobra maneuver, a favorite maneuver of Russian fighters

Russian Army Gets More Upgraded TOS-1A Thermobaric Rocket Launchers 
Uralvagonzavod, a part of the Russian state-owned Rostec defense conglomerate, has delivered a batch of upgraded TOS-1A ‚ÄúSolntsepyok‚Äù thermobaric rocket systems to the Russian military.
The delivery came on the occasion of the Day of the Russian military‚Äôs Troops of Radiological, Chemical and Biological Defence (RHBZ) on November 13, the press service of Rostec said in a statement, noting that the new systems were equipped with ‚Äúa modernized anti-drone complex.‚Äù
‚ÄúPrior to delivery, in order to assess the quality and compliance with the requirements of the regulatory and technical documentation, the products were subjected to operational acceptance testing. According to the test results, the products demonstrated high quality and compliance with the tactical and technical characteristics and requirements of the delivery specifications,‚Äù the press service quoted a manufacturer representative as saying.

Overview of Russian-Ukrainian Strikes. Polish Foreign Ministry: Kyiv Ready to Fight for Three More Years
Russia and Ukraine exchanged mutual strikes on November 11-12, 2025, with the scale of strikes being roughly equal. According to statements from the Russian Ministry of Defense, 130 Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) were destroyed over Russian territory. In turn, the Ukrainian Air Force reported that 138 attack UAVs were launched against Ukrainian territory, of which 102 were shot down/suppressed.
The Russian armed forces carried out a series of strikes on targets within Ukraine, primarily concentrated in the country's southern and central regions. The most intense attacks targeted the Dnipropetrovsk region, where warehouses, service stations, and supply lines in Ternivka, Vasylivka, and Dmitrivka were hit. In Vasylivka, a local feed mill was also seriously damaged. Additionally, strikes hit Arzys in the Odesa region, damaging a locomotive depot...

Danylivka Captured: Threat Of Encirclement Looms Over Ukrainian Grouping In Huliaipole
Russian assault units have established control over Synelnykove after a year and a half of fighting in the area. The Russian army took control of Mine 5/6 in the south of Myrnohrad. 
EU finance ministers failed to reach an agreement on using Russian Central Bank assets to support Ukraine.
